alert.note: Alert for Ford; Hodgeman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Ford and southeastern Hodgeman Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Wright, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing one half inch hail at Dodge City, along wind wind gusts near 50 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jetmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
